data.text:
Saiyuki Reload -ZEROIN- Anime Adapts Saiyuki’s “Even a Worm” Arc

Saiyuki is headed back to screens. The newest anime adaptation of the manga by Kazuya Minekura will be called Saiyuki Reload -ZEROIN-. It’ll cover the manga’s “Even a Worm” arc.

-ZEROIN- will star returning cast members:

Toshihiko Seki as Genjo Sanzo

Soichiro Hoshi as Son Goku

Hiroaki Hirata as Sha Gojyo

Akira Ishida as Cho Hakkai

It’ll be animated over at LIDEN FILMS.

Saiyuki creator Minekura celebrated the news by whipping up a some key art and a new logo.

Here’s how Kodansha describes the Saiyuki manga:

Genjo is a Buddhist priest in the city of Shangri-La, which is being ravaged by yokai spirits that have fallen out of balance with the natural order. His superiors send him on a journey far to the west to discover why this is happening and how to stop it. His companions are three yokai with human souls. But this is no day trip—the four will encounter many discoveries and horrors on the way, and on the road, Genjo will wonder … can he really trust his supernatural companions?
